full_text: In the previous demonstration, I created a page showing a list of officials. Now I need to add it to the UI. Note the red outline, indicating that this page has not yet been added to a location group. The page should appear on the Claim tab, so I navigate to the Claim Location group. The requirement is that it should appear under Parties Involved, so I double-click the Parties Involved Location group. Note that only two widget types appear in the toolbox. I click Location Ref. and drop it at the bottom of the Location group, below Users. The Location Ref appears in red, because its location property has not been configured. Similarly, it is labeled Null because its label property has not been configured. I click the Location Ref to open its properties. The value of the Location property is the one entry point, or signature, I created for the Claim Officials page. For the Label property, I will use the same Display Key I used for the Claim Officials page. If I now return to the Claim Officials page, I see that the red outline is gone, indicating that the page is fully configured. I also click the Location Ref to open its properties. I also see that the page displays a tab bar, and Actions menu, and a sidebar, indicating that the page is associated with a location group. Now I can test my configurations in the user interface. I log in as Andy Applegate. I'll navigate to the Ray Newton claim. In the sidebar, I expand the Parties Involved group. There is a link for the Claim Officials page, as expected. The page appears correctly as I configured it. There is an empty list, where I can add and delete officials. If I click the Edit button, the Iterator buttons appear. The Add button is available, so I click it. For the type of the official, I select Coroner. I give the Coroner a name. And enter the number of the Coroner's report. Now I'll add a Police Officer and a Police Report. If I now check the Select box for the Coroner, the Remove button becomes available. If I click it, the record is correctly removed. Clicking Update saves my work. If I now navigate to the Lost Details page, the Officials list displays the Police Officer I created. Though there are further tests I can and should perform in a real implementation, they are repetitive, and would be distractions from the main topic. This ends the Configuring Location Group Components demonstration.

segments.text: In the previous demonstration, I created a page showing a list of officials. Now I need to add it to the UI. Note the red outline, indicating that this page has not yet been added to a location group. The page should appear on the Claim tab, so I navigate to the Claim Location group. The requirement is that it should appear under Parties Involved, so I double-click the Parties Involved Location group. Note that only two widget types appear in the toolbox. I click Location Ref.

and drop it at the bottom of the Location group, below Users. The Location Ref appears in red, because its location property has not been configured. Similarly, it is labeled Null because its label property has not been configured. I click the Location Ref to open its properties. The value of the Location property is the one entry point, or signature, I created for the Claim Officials page.
For the Label property, I will use the same Display Key I used for the Claim Officials page.
If I now return to the Claim Officials page, I see that the red outline is gone, indicating that the page is fully configured. I also click the Location Ref to open its properties.
I also see that the page displays a tab bar, and Actions menu, and a sidebar, indicating that the page is associated with a location group.
Now I can test my configurations in the user interface. I log in as Andy Applegate.
I'll navigate to the Ray Newton claim. In the sidebar, I expand the Parties Involved group. There is a link for the Claim Officials page, as expected.

The page appears correctly as I configured it. There is an empty list, where I can add and delete officials. If I click the Edit button, the Iterator buttons appear. The Add button is available, so I click it.
For the type of the official, I select Coroner. I give the Coroner a name.
And enter the number of the Coroner's report.
Now I'll add a Police Officer and a Police Report.
If I now check the Select box for the Coroner, the Remove button becomes available. If I click it, the record is correctly removed.
Clicking Update saves my work. If I now navigate to the Lost Details page, the Officials list displays the Police Officer I created.
Though there are further tests I can and should perform in a real implementation, they are repetitive, and would be distractions from the main topic.
This ends the Configuring Location Group Components demonstration.
